reviewText:
After the war in Veitnam, Putt Putt, a broken man; was dealing with alchohol addiction and PTSD. He was broke, and always on edge, but then he met Dr.Firebird. Dr.Firebird offered Putt Putt a chance to change everything that happened in 'Nam; using a time machine. Putt Putt accepts this mission, as a way of redemption for everything that happened in 'Nam. Will Putt Putt stop 'Nam from ever happening?! Will he finally be happy?! Find out in this new zany adventure: Putt Putt Travels Through Time.


10/10 An emotional, heartwrenching journey; a must buy.

reviewText:
While I find the character of Putt-Putt to be somewhat one-dimensional, the game more than makes up for it with its rich atmosphere and spot on driving physics.

As a 32 year old man who was homeschooled, I really appreciated the history lesson and problem solving skills this game provided me with.

I don't want to give any spoilers, but I will say that I believe I can use some examples from this game, how I figured out how to use the nickel, for example, as an indication of my problem solving skills, which I can list on my resume. Thank you Putt-Putt!

reviewText: From visionary science fiction writer William Gibson in collaboration with suspense legend Stephen King, a pair made in heaven, bring you this unfinished story from the lost manuscripts of Philip K ♥♥♥♥.This is the tragic story of a young car, a dog, and a quest. A quest to fix time and save the almighty paper that has the power to rewrite history. I don’t want to give too much away but the story is quite a tearjerker and with more suspense than anything i've played in years. The gameplay is not dated at all, and the graphics look almost as good as the original crysis. The game keeps track of your choices and everything has an impact. The level design is spectacular, giving you many different ways to solve the many puzzles and encounters in the game. The cinematics are also stunning, clearly ahead of their time. The only real complaint I have is that sometimes it’s way to easy to be killed, Dark Souls really took some pointers from Putt Putt, other than that its quite an experience. I would not recommend this for those under 18 because of the dark themes and surprisingly lewd content and language. I’d also like to note that you must be a seasoned gamer to truly appreciate some of the mechanics and get the most out of your experience. All in all Putt Putt Travels Through Time is a justice to gamers everywhere, and deserves it’s place in the vaults of time.

reviewText: An Instant Childhood Point-and-Click Classic from the Days of my Childhood, which consist of the old MS-DOS, Windows 3.1, Windows 95, Windows 98 & Windows 98SE PCs. Another Personal Favorite game of mine in which you help Putt-Putt get back Pep, his Calculator, History Report & Smokey the Fire Engine Lunchbox which are scattered across The Time Continuum in 4 Different Time Periods: The Mesozoic Era (220-64 Million BC), The Middle Ages (410-1499 AD), The American Frontier (1800-1929) & even The Distant Future.\n\nPutt-Putt Travels Through Time is also out for the iOS App Store if you want to play it wherever you go on either your iPhone or iPad.

reviewText: A lot of educational games back from the 90's had charm to them and were actually fun to play. Putt-Putt Travels Through Time is no exception. Colorful graphics, catchy music, fun characters, and overall, is the perfect game for a child. If you're older, it'll no doubt be no challenge to beat (it took me about thirty minutes, even though I have over an hour on my records), but when you're younger, it'll take some time. There is actually some backtracking to the game, and the random nature of the game will give the young ones some fun and those that enjoyed it back in the day some nostalgia.

reviewText: So much instant nostalgia right from the start page, followed by crushing embarrassment at the childish tone. I was definitely five when I played this for hours on end. Nonetheless I learned and gained so much from it I'd recommend to any young child, a simple point-and-click adventure can sure keep lasting values, arithmetic, and humor.\n\nTo the present age of twenty-two every few years I've craved and wondered what a Chewy Fruity Wagon Wheel would taste like, and nothing has  seemed worthy yet. I'll update if I do find something as similar as possible.

reviewText:
In an era where video games are dominated by guns, muscles, and hats, it never hurts to go back to a simpler time. A time where when you got stuck on level 3 of Battletoads, you were pretty much screwed (Okay, this game is past that, but I have a review I'm trying to do here.) Basically, anyone who plays this is the gamer equivalent of an Amish. I can already hear the IBM computers.

All laughs aside, this game is great if you're 6 years old, and I assure you I am. The animation is appealing, the things you click on are varied enough so that you don't slump over dead from boredom, and the puzzles aren't completely mindless.

Don't play this game unless you're really young or have siblings, or you just want to feel the NESTELGUH dripping from your sensitive parts.

8.5/10

reviewText: This Putt-Putt game is probably the best one. Each playthrough is different (up to a point--it doesn't have infinite possibilities), and the world is big enough that it doesn't get tiresome. The characters are a lot of fun, and there are lots of mini games scattered throughout to break up the adventure. It's really a great game, even as old as it is.

reviewText:
A timeless classic about a car that travels back and forth through time just to find his school supplies and pet dog.

Key features include:
Playing simon says with volcanos
Exploring the desert
Making food for a penguin/dragon/turtle hybrid
Scratching a dinosaurs back
Forcing an elephant to ski down a mountain of glue
Objects getting scattered in different areas each time you play
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I bought this on sale (most Humongous titles go on sale every few weeks or so) and it was worth the money. I had only played Putt-Putt Enters the Race before this, and although the voice actor for Putt-Putt is different (which was off-putting at first), this game is still great fun and has a lot of variety to it. The story is fun, the characters are unique, and the game is big and varied enough that you could play it multiple times in a row and still have fun.\n\n8/10 for a kid's game, I'd easily recommend it...especially when it's on sale.
